row.entry: A distributed event streaming platform and message broker.
A node typically between decoder and encoder nodes that is specialized in mediation function, such as validation, enrichment, correlation or conversion.
Charging Data Record, Call Data Record or Call Detail Record, is an organized collection of information about the chargeable telecommunication events such as voice calls, data sessions, SMS or MMS.

entry.p: A network element or application server interface for usage data collection.
A collector node receives the usage data either as files (batch mode) or event records (real-time mode).

row.entry: Process reading from an Apache Kafka topic.
A mediator that manages data streams and controls data collection, storing and processing routines in a communication network.
A node specialized in decoding certain types of event records, such as XML, log files or ASN.1, into Data Refinery internal data format for further processing.

entry.p: A target system specific interface for event record delivery and sometimes formatting.
The target system of a distributor node is typically an OSS/BSS system.

row.entry: Event Data Record or Event Detail Record, generated as a result of an event, for example for subscription changes.
Term used for messages coming out of an Apache Kafka topic, i.e. outbound messages.
A node that encodes the event records from Data Refinery internal format into a certain type of output data, such as ASN.1, XML or ASCII.
A data record processed by the streams in Data Refinery.

entry.p: A record that is omitted and not sent to further processing.
The record is not stored in any file or storage, only an audit counter is incremented.

row.entry: A table with external lookup data that is used for data enrichment. A typical lookup table contains search and return values. Lookup tables are maintained by the end customer.
A piece of telecommunications equipment, such as a switch, MSC, GPRS Charging Gateway, SMSC, that provides support or services to the user.
A generic name for an independent Data Refinery module that collects, decodes, processes, encodes or distributes event records.
Logical entity holding a piece of data for a particular Apache Kafka topic. Partitions allow topics to be parallelized by splitting the data into a particular topic across multiple brokers.
A chain of nodes that are linked together and are responsible for collection, delivery and different data processing tasks.
A record that contains invalid data and is stored into a rejected data storage, from which it can be reprocessed later.
A category/feed name to which records are stored and published in Apache Kafka broker.
